Value Statement As a cloud infra engineer who prepares test environment for WASA assessment, I need the ability to validate new test service accounts so that these test accounts are ready to be used by WASA pen testing team.

Acceptance Criteria

1. When the cloud infra engineers receives test accounts detail, the cloud infra engineer has the ability to create BOSD ticket to request accounts added to proper BIP groups.

2. When BIP groups are added to the test accounts, the cloud infra engineer can use them to login BIP AI gateway app.

 

Assumption We'll get accounts detail next sprint from request [https://jira.devops.va.gov/servicedesk/customer/portal/89/ICMO-2421]

Note We'll need to create a bip-ai-blue domain for internal testing (also for this WASA)
items.to_string:
Value Statement As a BIP AI cloud infra engineer who manages Jenkins, I need the ability to update Jenkins service role to use new IaC IAM role so that most updated policies in IAM role is used by Jenkins.

Acceptance Criteria

1 When a cloud infra engineer updates stage and preprod Jenkins service role, Jenkins uses the new IaC IAM role to run jobs properly.

2 The old CFT IAM role is decommissioned.

items.from_string: Creation - Deploy SCC KB to preprod
items.to_string: Creation - Deploy SCC KB to preprod so that I can validate knowledge retrieval and integration before production use.

Title Log SCC upcoming deployment dates in Confluence documentation for team awareness Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who supports tenant teams like SCC, I need the ability to log upcoming SCC deployment dates in Confluence documentation so that team members and stakeholders can easily view and plan around scheduled deployments.

Acceptance Criteria

When an SCC deployment is scheduled, the upcoming deployment date is added to the designated Confluence documentation page. The documentation is updated promptly when new deployment dates are confirmed or changed. Deployment entries include the date and a brief description if available. Manual validation: Review Confluence page to confirm upcoming deployment dates are listed.

items.from_string: Provide SCC deployment dates to confluence calendar
items.to_string: Provide SCC deployment dates to confluence calendar so that team members and stakeholders can easily view and plan around scheduled deployments

Value Statement

As a BIP AI Tenant who manages Gen Ann applications, I need the ability to access clear documentation on promotion and deployment processes so that I can efficiently and correctly promote and deploy my application with minimal confusion or errors.

Acceptance Criteria:

When a user accesses the Confluence space, the Gen Ann promotion and deployment process is documented in a dedicated page. The documentation includes step-by-step instructions and any required prerequisites. Manual validation: Review Confluence page to confirm the process is clearly documented.

items.from_string: Create Confluence Document for GenAnn promotion and deployment processes
items.to_string: Create Confluence Document for GenAnn promotion and deployment processes efficiently and correctly promote and deploy application with minimal confusion or error

Value Statement

As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who supports tenant teams, I need the ability to reference and contribute to a guide section on commonly-faced issues and their solutions so that I can resolve tenant problems more efficiently and consistently.

Acceptance Criteria

When a solution engineer encounters a common issue, they have access to a documented section in the guide with troubleshooting steps and resolutions. The guide is updated to include at least several frequently encountered issues and their solutions. Manual validation: Review the guide to confirm the new section is present and contains relevant content.

items.from_string: Add section to solution engineer guide for commonly-faced issues and how to address them
items.to_string: Add section to solution engineer guide for commonly-faced issues and how to address them to resolve tenant problems more efficiently and consistently

Value Statement

As a BIP AI Tenant who is onboarding to the platform, I need the ability to attend a finalized intro session during the Tenant Support Forum so that I can gain a clear understanding of platform features and workflows to accelerate my adoption and success.

Acceptance Criteria

When the Tenant Support Forum is held, the BIP AI intro session is delivered with finalized content and materials. Any final edits or updates to the session materials are completed before delivery. Manual validation: Confirm the session is delivered and materials are shared with attendees.
Deliver BIP AI intro session to accelerate understanding of features and workflows for adoption

As a BIP AI Gateway user, I want to be guided on how to gain access to a domain, so that I can request access without reaching out to BIP-AI support.

Acceptance Criteria
 * When a user logs into the gateway and doesn't see any domains, there will be new UI text saying "Don't see a domain? Click here for help"
 * - Clicking this text will bring up a wizard to guide users to BOSD to get the correct groups
 * - If a domain does appear (which means they have the correct role) but the user doesn't have a user profile, the connect button will become a "Request Access" button
 * - Clicking the "Request Access" button will pull up a wizard to submit a BIP-AI support ticket

A/C: Values for FAQ and PII are added to the IaC for the mlops API and loaded into a configmap

Value Statement As a cloud infra engineer who managed python package repo artifactory, I need the ability to sync up with other BIP teams so that we can have requirement, best practice and future tasks identified and documented.

Acceptance Criteria

1. When the cloud infra engineer brainstorm with other BIP teams for how to use python package repo artifactory in python development, requirement, best practice and future tasks are identified and documented.

As a tenant of BIP-AI, I want my Crossplane claims to be deployed via the BIP-AI tenant app until support exists for us to deploy our own claims to AI resources.

- When a tenants claim is deployed, then it should be deployed via the BIP-AI tenants app in tenant ArgoCD. To support this effort, we need to create the bip-ai-tenant-claims app until we can iterate through supporting claims directly in tenant apps. This ticket has a follow-on to prototype and develop a migration script that handles moving claims safely.

- When a tenants claim is deployed, then it should be deployed via the BIP-AI tenants app in tenant ArgoCD. To support this effort, we need to create the bip-ai-tenant-claims app until we can iterate through supporting claims directly in tenant apps. This ticket has a follow-on to prototype and develop a migration script that handles moving claims safely.

As a tenant of BIP-AI, I want my Crossplane claims to be deployed via the BIP-AI tenant app until support exists for us to deploy our own claims to AI resources.
 - When a tenants claim is deployed, then it should be deployed via the BIP-AI tenants app in tenant ArgoCD.
 - To support this effort, we need to create the bip-ai-tenant-claims app until we can iterate through supporting claims directly in tenant apps.
 - This ticket has a follow-on to prototype and develop a migration script that handles moving claims safely.

items.from_string:
As a tenant of BIP-AI, I want my Crossplane claims to be deployed via the BIP-AI tenant app until support exists for us to deploy our own claims to AI resources.
 - When a tenants claim is deployed, then it should be deployed via the BIP-AI tenants app in tenant ArgoCD.
 - To support this effort, we need to create the bip-ai-tenant-claims app until we can iterate through supporting claims directly in tenant apps.
 - This ticket has a follow-on to prototype and develop a migration script that handles moving claims safely.
items.to_string:
As a tenant of BIP-AI, I want my Crossplane claims to be deployed via the BIP-AI tenant app until support exists for us to deploy our own claims to AI resources.
 - When a tenants claim is deployed, then it should be deployed via the BIP-AI tenants app in -tenant- tooling ArgoCD under the bip-ai AppSet.
 - To support this effort, we need to create the bip-ai-claims app
 - This ticket has a follow-on to prototype and develop a migration script that handles moving claims safely.

As the BIP-AI team, I want to be able to deploy Crossplane claims for our application and domain resources with detached values from bip-ai-infrastructure to allow for easier updates without having to create releases.

- When our team deploys Crossplane claims then a helm template should exist in the bip-ai-infrastructure repository under the compositions or gateway app (depending on use-case) and allow for values to be detached coming from the bip-ai-infrastructure-values repository
This issue is cloned by BIP-26146

As a tenant of BIP-AI, I want to be able to provision Bedrock Agents and Knowledge Bases.
 * When tenants want to provision Bedrock Agents and KBs then we should have a self-service method which requires the use of IaC. We need to research the available providers for Crossplane and/or Terraform and test methods for deploying these resources.
 * - When we decide on the way forward, then we should have a plan documented and possible alternatives like API calls/boto3 in Confluence as an ADR.
This issue is cloned by BIP-26379

As a tenant of BIP-AI, I need my JupyterLab and CodeEditor apps to automatically shutdown when idle for too long to save on costs.

A/C:
 * When a Jupyter Lab or CodeEditor app is left idle for 120 minutes, then it should automatically shutdown.
 * - When we need to manage the autoshutdown and idle configuration for JupyterLab Apps and CodeEditor then it should be done via IaC. This should be part of the default Sagemaker Domain configuration in the XSagemakerDomain composition so it applies to all domains. The parameter should be adjustable via the claim, but default to 120 minutes.

As an infra engineer I need to research and protype using the Grafana crossplane provider , so that dashboards can be deployed using IaC and Automation

A/C:

- Setup a local instance of grafana

- Deploy the Grafana crossplane provider https://marketplace.upbound.io/providers/grafana/provider-grafana/v0.30.0 - Use the grafana provider deploy an dashboard to your local grafana instance

items.from_string: Prototype using Crossplane Grafana provider in local enviornment
items.to_string: Prototype using Crossplane Grafana provider in local environment to allow dashboards to be deployed using IaC and Automation

As a tenant of BIP-AI, I want my MLFlow instance to have immutable storage via a PVC that is not part of the helm chart so it remains if the chart is uninstalled.

- When we deploy MLFlow for tenants, then the PVC should be created/managed by Crossplane and detached from the helm chart so that if the chart has to be replaced/uninstalled the storage remains which keeps the MLFlow instances ephemeral without losing storage.

items.to_string:
As a developer working on BIP AI, I need to create a reusable prompt library for test generation So that I can quickly generate accurate test cases for my code using GitHub Copilot or any integrated LLM Without manually crafting prompts each time.

Acceptance Criteria: When a developer opens the testing repository, they can find a prompt-library/folder containing multiple tested prompt templates.

Each prompt template includes: A short description of its intended use An example snippet of code to pair with the prompt Guidance on how to paste and use it with GitHub Copilot The prompt library includes templates for: Unit testing Python functions API endpoint testing with pytest Edge case generation A README.md in the prompt library explains how to use the prompts, where to paste them, and which tools they’re optimized for.

Impact Statement: Enables all tenants and engineers on BIP AI to accelerate test development Maintains quality and improves onboarding by providing standard prompt templates ready for AI-assisted workflows

items.from_string: Create Prompt Library for AI-Assisted Test Case Generation
items.to_string: Create Prompt Library for AI-Assisted Test Case Generation to quickly generate cases for code using GitHub Copilot

Value Statement

As a BIP AI Tenant who uses the SageMaker Studio code editor, I need the environment to be configured seamlessly through updated Lifecycle Configuration (LCC) so that I can start working efficiently without manual setup or troubleshooting.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user launches the SageMaker Studio code editor, the updated LCC is automatically applied for a ready-to-use environment. The LCC changes address issues or improvements identified in previous investigations. Documentation is updated here: [link to LCC or environment setup documentation] Manual validation: Confirm the updated LCC is applied and the environment is configured as expected for tenants.
SM code editor LCC updates to mitigate manual setup and troubleshooting

AC: - Update existing attachment script to attach to shared space.

Title: Remove mlmats references from BIP AI repos for consistency Value Statement

As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains platform code and documentation, I need the ability to find and remove all references to "mlmats" in BIP AI repositories so that terminology is consistent across all code and documentation.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user searches the repos, all instances of "mlmats" are identified and replaced with "BIP AI" or the appropriate current term. No outdated "mlmats" references remain in code, documentation, or configuration files. Functionality that will validate that this story is complete: Manual review or automated search confirms all references have been updated for consistency.

items.from_string: Find and remove mlmats references in relevant repos
items.to_string: Find and remove mlmats references in relevant repos so that terminology is consistent

Value Statement

As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages platform repositories, I need to identify and remove stale branches in key repos so that the repositories remain organized and easy to maintain.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user reviews the repos, stale or unused branches in bip-ai-kit, tenant resources, and mlops template are identified and deleted as appropriate. No unnecessary or outdated branches remain in these repositories. Functionality that will validate that this story is complete: Manual review confirms stale branches have been cleaned up.

items.from_string: Clean up stale branches in bip-ai-kit, tenant resources, mlops template repos
items.to_string: Clean up stale branches in bip-ai-kit, tenant resources, mlops template repos so that the repositories remain organized and easy to maintain

Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains platform code, I need to review and enhance in-code documentation in key repositories so that the codebase is easier to understand and maintain for all contributors.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user reviews the code in bip-ai-kit, tenant resources, or bip mlops template, in-code documentation (comments, docstrings) is clear, accurate, and helpful. Areas with missing or unclear documentation are identified and improved. Functionality that will validate that this story is complete: Manual review confirms in-code documentation is improved and up to date in all three repos.

As an MLE I want to create a data pipeline that will take the files from the GitHub repo for the BIP platform and refresh it into the knowledge base

A SageMaker pipeline to pull the files from GitHub. The pipeline will then put the files into the s3 knowledge base and resync the knowledge base

 # grab the github files and upload to the s3 bucket
 # sync the bedrock knowledge base so the new files can be used

https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-ai-tenant-resources/blob/dev/tutorials/notebooks/machine_learning/bedrock/knowledgebase_tutorial.ipynb

 

s3 bucket:

s3://project-bip-ai-dev-usgw1-core/bedrock/bippy/knowledgebase/
